intro: Illicium cubense subsp. guajaibonense, commonly known as the Guajaibon illicium, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Schisandraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces dark purple berries that contain aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
